summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, attaching materials for a Deputy Attorney General meeting. It provides an overview of cases likely to generate press, focusing on the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution and mentions work on a potential resolution with another Epstein co-conspirator.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The email is addressed to her, and she is the recipient of the meeting overview materials regarding cases including U.S. v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the case U.S. v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AM), described as an Epstein associate charged with sex trafficking. The document notes motions practice may draw press.

connections.description: Maxwell is explicitly described as an 'Epstein associate' in the context of the sex trafficking case against her.

events.title: DAG Meeting Case Overview
events.description: A meeting for the Deputy Attorney General to review cases likely to generate substantial press, including the Maxwell prosecution.

events.title: Motions Practice in U.S. v. Maxwell
events.description: Ongoing legal motions in the sex trafficking case against Ghislaine Maxwell, which may draw press attention, particularly efforts to secure victim identities.

keyFacts: The document is an internal government email preparing for a high-level meeting (Deputy Attorney General) about cases expected to generate press.
It highlights the Ghislaine Maxwell sex trafficking case (U.S. v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330) as a key focus, noting motions practice could draw media attention.
It reveals prosecutors were 'working on potential resolution with another Epstein co-conspirator' at the time, indicating ongoing negotiations beyond Maxwell.
The email shows coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) on managing public and press aspects of high-profile Epstein-related cases.
